text: [ventilator cycling] okay tidal volume six-fifty pressure thirty two looks fine
blood pressure one-ten over sixty five heart rate ninety-five sat ninety eight
[metal tray clink] retractors in please
lungs still clear equal breath sounds both sides
[beeping steady]
sat dropping ninety two check probe
probe good waveform losing volume on the vent peak pressure creeping up forty
ETCO2 down from thirty-five to twenty eight
[beep beep beep faster] blood pressure eighty systolic
give a hundred phenylephrine
check tube depth twenty two at the teeth still secured
bag manually compliance feels tight
sat now eighty five heart rate one-ten
turn the oxygen up to hundred percent confirm bilateral breath sounds again
[stethoscope noise] left side diminished maybe absent right side loud
ETCO2 twenty two still falling
pressure on the vent forty-five rising
pulse oximeter seventy eight no improvement with bagging
heart rate one-twenty blood pressure sixty over thirty
[alarm tone escalating]
check circuit for obstruction none
tube patent suction clear no secretions
could be bronchospasm try albuterol
no change still high pressure low return volume
sat seventy three we are losing pressure sixty systolic
turn off nitrous run full oxygen switch to manual vent
listen again nothing left side none
[clamor background voices overlapping] maybe tension pneumo developing
trachea deviated right jugular distention
heart sounds faint muffled sat sixty eight
BP fifty over palpable barely heart rate one-forty
[alarm continuous] stop insufflation hold ventilation
confirm right side breath only left silent yes tension pneumothorax
prepare for needle decompression fourteen gauge left mid-axillary
[metal clang instruments handed over]
skin antiseptic ready inserting needle now
[hiss of escaping air] got rush of air good
pressure dropping on the vent thirty now easier to bag
ETCO2 climbing twenty five thirty
sat seventy two now seventy eight improving
heart rate slowing one-ten blood pressure seventy over forty climbing
[alarm tone slowing normalizing]
repeat breath sounds bilateral movement returning left faint but present
ETCO2 thirty-five sat eighty five ninety
blood pressure ninety five over fifty stabilizing
okay tension decompressed preparing for chest tube
please hold ventilation short bursts only
[suction noise] placing tube tray up
sat ninety eight heart rate ninety pressure one-ten over sixty good recovery
vent pressures normalized tidal volume back to baseline
continue monitoring confirm no re-accumulation
[beeping steady normal rhythm]
document tension pneumothorax needle decompression performed improvement noted
send arterial blood gas confirm ventilation status
ETCO2 thirty eight sat ninety nine stable
[team quiets down sounds normalize]
okay continuing surgery once chest tube placed patient stable resume routine monitoring
